name: clay roof tile production, glazed | clay roof tile | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/30249/documentation

This dataset describes the production of modern clay roof tiles in the area of San José de Balzay in Ecuador. The dataset represents the production of 1 kg of tile, with the following characteristics: average weight of 0.84 kg and average dimensions of (31 x 17 x 6 x 0.82) cm (length x width x curvature arrow x thickness). Data was obtained from measurements and information provided in the factory visited in June 2022 ("El Artesano Fábrica de Tejas"). Some data was calculated using literature values. This dataset was developed by Estefania Barros, Kristi Padrón, Jonnathan Aguirre and Juan Sebastian Martines, under the supervision of Prof. Dolores Sucozhañay and Prof. Paul Vanegas, from the Inclusive Circular Economy and Sustainable Development Research Group of the University of Cuenca (ECI) in the frame of the CEELA (Strengthening capacities for energy efficiency in buildings in Latin America) project with the support of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).;The dataset includes the whole manufacturing process of the clay roof tile. It does not include charge of the wastewater nor solid waste from containers and packaging. 

The activity starts with the reception of raw materials at the clay roof tile production site.

This dataset ends with the storage of the produced glazed tiles. It includes the reception of raw materials, dosing, mixing, forming and cutting, drying, first firing, varnishing, second firing, cooling and storage. The dataset does not include the packaging.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2392:Manufacture of clay building materials

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is from 2022 (year of data collection) to 2023 (year of dataset compilation).
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data was obtained in a factory of modern clay roof tile (glazed) located in San José de Balzay and Racar, Cuenca, Ecuador.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current production technology. This dataset corresponds to manufacturing of a clay roof tile, (glazed) factory, which incorporates machinery in their processes. ;The manufacturing process includes the reception of raw materials, dosing, mixing, forming by extrusion, drying, first firing, varnishing, second firing, cooling and storage of tiles. For both firing, wood is used. Varnishing and the second process of firing are done in order to produce glazed tiles. These processes make use of two chemicals (lead oxide and silica), and increase the amount of wood used for the oven. The process begins by the mixing of raw materials. The mix is deposited in a mill, then moved an extruder formed by a mixer and a matrix.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: The exchange "chemical, organic" is used as a proxy for lead oxide.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data gathered in a modern clay roof tile (glazed) factory through a process assessment in a technical visit. Azuay is one of the main producers of clay tile and the production process is similar in Ecuador, according to literature. Land occupation exchange is used as an estimate of infrastructure. Machinery use is accounted for through their fuel / electricity consumption.

exchanges.description: The dataset represents 1 kg of clay roof tile. One roof tile has average dimensions (31 x 17 x 6 x 0.82) cm (length x width x curvature arrow x thickness) and measured average mass of 0.84 kg.

flow.name: clay roof tile
flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2392:Manufacture of clay building materials

exchanges.description: Estimated for infrastructure. Land occupation calculated as the land occupied by the production facility (0.25 ha) divided by the average annual production volume of the facility (3'826'620 kg clay roof tile/year).

flow.name: Occupation, bare area (non-use)
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/land

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Calculated as the difference between the amount of inputs (wood fuel, oxygen) and outputs (CO2, CO, SO2, Nox, VOC and PM10) from the firing process. Wood ash is produced from the combustion of wood during the firing process.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. This value represents the amount of various types of clay used for the production of 1 kg of clay roof tile, according to measurements and the information provided by the owner of the factory. The types of clay used are "tierra cera", "tierra negra", "tierra roja" and "tierra amarilla". "Tierra roja" is also known as "sandy".

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the volume of diesel per kg of brick (0.0105 L/kg) by the heating value of diesel (35.86 MJ/L). Diesel is used in the extruder machine.

exchanges.description: It's assumed that the lubricating oil must be disposed of after use (the lubricating oil is used to lube the machinery and does not become part of the product). Therefore, same amount as lubricating oil input is used to model the waste.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Carbon monoxide emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.name: Carbon monoxide, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. VOC emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Volume of lubricating oil per kg of clay roof tile by the density of lubricating oil. Lubricating oil is used for the extrusion machine. Maintenance is usually done every 3 months.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the bulb power per kg of clay roof tile (1.98E-5 kW/kg) by the working hours that use electricity (4h). One light bulb is used in the firing section when workers have to work early in the morning when it is still dark.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Since the wood chips are measured as dry mass, this is multiplied by the water mass of the wood, which is 2.1kg. Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. CO2 emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.name: Carbon dioxide, non-fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The value represents the amount of used (old) pallets that are used as fuel in the firing process for the production of 1 kg of glazed clay roof tiles as informed by the owner of the factory. Wood chips are used as proxy for the used pallets used for the firing process. The number of pallets used per firing process is 260 units. Each unit weights 25kg. Since the wood chips are measured as dry mass, this is divided by the water mass of the wood, which is 2.1kg. This is then divived by the kg of clay roof tiles per firing process (5036.3 kg).

flow.name: wood chips, wet, measured as dry mass

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Sulfur dioxide emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Particulate matter emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. PM10 emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Particulate matter is < 10 um. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Water content used for the production process based on measurements and the information provided by the owner of the factory. Water used for the production of clay roof tiles is water obtained from the rain.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Multiplying the kg of fuel (wood) per kg of clay brick by the emission factor of the pollutant (kg/kg). Based on literature calculations and information provided by the owners of the factories. Nitrogen oxides emission is produced from combustion of wood during the firing process. Reference: Jaya Sucozhañay, J. L., & Gomezcoello Vásquez, J. L. (2012). Análisis comparativo de la contaminación atmosférica producida por la combustión en ladrilleras artesanales utilizando tres tipos de combustibles (Bachelor's thesis).

flow.name: Nitrogen oxides
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The wastewater was modelled as the water difference between the amount of rainwater used in the process together with the water contained in the clay, and the water evaporated from the brick after the firing process. The water is captured in a hole in the ground, where the mixing takes place. Therefore, the excess water is infiltrated by the soil and follows a natural process, where it eventually reaches groundwater or a water body.

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to water/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Evaporated water is produced during two processes: 1) Combustion process, where water in wet mass amount in the wood chips gets evaporated (calculated as wood_fuel*water_in_wet_mass/1000); and 2) Drying process of the roof tiles (weight of a just made tile and a fired tile are considered).

flow.name: Water
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/unspecified

exchanges.description: Calculated value. The amount of tiles that are damaged in the oven as informed by the owner of the factory is considered (250 * 0.84 kg). This value is divided by the kg of roof tiles produced per firing process, to obtain the kg of damaged bricks per kg of clay roof tile.

exchanges.description: This exchange is used as a proxy for lead oxide. Calculated value. 50kg of lead oxide per 6000 tiles. Lead oxide is used as a varnish for glazed roof tiles. 0.84kg is the clay roof tile mass.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. Silica is mixed with lead oxide as a varnish for glazed roof tiles. 12.5kg of the mix per 6000 tiles. 0.84kg is the clay roof tile mass.
